item.title: Why Fire Is Powered by the Sun
item.description: This video explains how the energy released by fire ultimately comes from sunlight, tracing the connection through plants, fossil fuels, and the long-term storage of solar energy.

media:content.media:title: Why Fire Is Powered by the Sun
media:content.media:description: This video explains how the energy released by fire ultimately comes from sunlight, tracing the connection through plants, fossil fuels, and the long-term storage of solar energy.

item.title: Why Mold Appears on the International Space Station
item.description: This video explains how mold can form aboard the ISS, where it comes from, and how astronauts manage microbial growth in a closed, microgravity environment.

item.title: How Is Memory Stored in the Human Brain?
item.description: This video explains how memories form and persist, exploring the roles of neurons, synapses, and brain regions involved in learning, recall, and long-term storage.

item.title: Which Planet Is the Oldest in Our Solar System?
item.description: This video explores how scientists determine the ages of planets and which worlds formed first, based on planetary formation, geology, and evidence from space missions.

item.title: Details You Miss During a Rocket Launch
item.description: This video highlights the small but important details often overlooked during a rocket launch, explaining what’s happening at each stage and why it matters from an engineering perspective.

item.title: Explaining the Big Bang to a Seven-Year-Old
item.description: This video breaks down the Big Bang in a simple, age-appropriate way, using clear ideas and everyday examples to make a complex science topic easy to understand.

item.title: The Future of the Sun, Billions of Years Ahead
item.description: This video explains what scientists expect to happen during the Sun’s final stages, billions of years from now, based on stellar evolution models and observations of similar stars.

item.title: How Did Life on Earth Begin?
item.description: This video looks at leading scientific ideas about the origins of life, from early chemistry on ancient Earth to ongoing research that helps explain how living systems may have emerged.

item.title: Are We Experiencing an Anti-Intellectual Trend?
item.description: This video explores concerns about declining trust in expertise and education, examining cultural, technological, and social factors that shape how information is shared and understood today.

item.title: What Would You Feed the Sun to Make It Last Longer?
item.description: This video explains how the Sun produces energy and whether adding hydrogen or helium could extend its life, using stellar physics to clarify how stars age and evolve.

item.title: How Much Fuel Do Rockets Really Need?
item.description: This video explains why rockets require so much fuel, covering gravity, mass, and orbital speed, and how engineers balance fuel needs with payload and mission goals.

item.title: Would 2D beings be invisible to our eye?
item.description: This video uses physics and geometry to explore how two-dimensional beings might appear from our three-dimensional perspective, and what this thought experiment reveals about dimensions.

item.title: How Does Brain Measure Time?
item.description: This video explores how the brain perceives and tracks time, from neural signals to attention and memory, and why our sense of time can speed up or slow down.

item.title: Can Humans Reach Mars by 2050?
item.description: This video examines the scientific, technological, and logistical challenges of sending humans to Mars, and what experts say would need to happen for such a mission to be feasible by 2050.

item.title: Why Do Boats Measure Speed in Knots?
item.description: This video explains the history and practical reasons behind using knots at sea, and why this traditional unit remains useful in modern navigation.

item.title: Why Don’t Children Like Vegetables?
item.description: This video looks at the science behind taste development, explaining why many children prefer sweet flavors and how eating habits change as we grow.

item.title: How Does Time Really Work?
item.description: This video explores how scientists understand time, from everyday measurement to modern physics, explaining key concepts in a clear and accessible way.

item.title: Can String Theory Explain the Universe?
item.description: This video introduces string theory in clear, simple terms, outlining its core ideas and why scientists study it as a possible framework for understanding the universe.

item.title: A Thought to Reflect On
item.description: This video offers a simple idea designed to encourage reflection and thoughtful discussion, inviting viewers to pause and consider a different perspective.

item.title: Do Cosmic Rays Affect Airplane Computers?
item.description: This video explores how cosmic rays interact with aircraft electronics and what engineers do to protect flight systems from rare, high-energy particle events.
